qas.question: When trees have a visible difference in color between sapwood and heartwood, which is darker?
What is deposited naturally in heartwood that changes its color?
Is the color difference between heartwood and sapwood usually very subtle or conspicuous?
What type of properties of heartwood and sapwood is often the same even if their colors are very different?
Although heartwood and sapwood might be similar mechanically, if their colors are very different, what other type of difference would they have?

context: In species which show a distinct difference between heartwood and sapwood the natural color of <a0_0>heartwood<a0_0/> is usually darker than that of the sapwood, and very frequently the contrast is <a2_0>conspicuous<a2_0/> (see section of yew log above). This is produced by deposits in the heartwood of <a1_0>chemical substances<a1_0/>, so that a dramatic color difference does not mean a dramatic difference in the <a3_0>mechanical<a3_0/> properties of heartwood and sapwood, although there may be a dramatic <a4_0>chemical<a4_0/> difference.
